group_1.textCenter: Oh man...it's not here, either...@This is around where I threw it, though...
Maybe it fell down a manhole or something?@I dunno...

group_1.textRight: Mikage, what are you crawling around@on the ground for?

group_1.textCenter: Um, I was looking for those sweets I threw@on the ground the other day...[chara:103801:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:103801:cheek_0][chara:103801:face_mtn_ex_050.exp.json][chara:103801:lipSynch_1]huh?

group_1.textLeft: Nayutan... Rabitan...

group_1.textRight: Letting a cute girl pick up candy thrown@on the ground is poor manners.
You are absolutely correct.
...Now, does this mean you plan on@entering the tree again?

group_1.textLeft: Yep.

group_1.textRight: Aren't you afraid?

group_1.textLeft: I am...but I wanna believe in my mom@just a little while longer,
'cause I know there's still hope.

group_1.textRight: It seems like something happened at school@to make you feel this way.
I understand.
I had a feeling something like this@would happen...and so.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:103801:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]*Gasp*
The stocking! And all those treats!@But why?!

group_1.textRight: As I said, I had a feeling something like@this might happen...
So I picked up what you threw away...
...in case you decided to learn more@about your mother's feelings.
I also got in touch with Puella Care@on your behalf.

group_1.textLeft: Nayutan... Rabitan...
Thank you for your patience.

group_1.textRight: Fumu!
Thanks a ton for coming out all this way,@Yozuru!

group_1.textLeft: Let us summon the tree posthaste.

group_1.textRight: C'mon out, tree!

group_1.textLeft: *Giggle* I'm glad it went well today, too.

group_1.textRight: ...I knew I wasn't mistaken.

group_1.textLeft: Come again?

group_1.textRight: Yesterday, after we left that other world,@the tree remained briefly visible.
In that moment, it appeared to be@decorated on the bottom half.

group_1.textLeft: Ah, that's right, the tree's only halfway@decorated!
All the red ornamentsâ€¦@Does that mean the voice we heard yesterday...
...marked the halfway point of our@collection?

group_1.textRight: Yes, I believe that is a reasonable@assumption.
...Let's take a moment to review what@we've learned about this power.
Fumuuu!

group_1.textLeft: Yes, there is much we do not know,@so perhaps a review is in order.

group_1.narration: "As I recall...it seems to be the case@that objects can contain the thoughts and@feelings of their owners."
"So Mii and my friends were building@a tree made up of these thoughts!"
"Yes, though we were entirely@unaware of it at first..."
"And in the space inside the tree, memories and@remembrances that are bound to feelings are left@as ornaments."
"When we touched them, we could hear@the conversations that made these memories!"
"Throughout yesterday, we heard the conversations@between the people who gave us this gift - that is to say,@Mikage's mother and her parents."

group_1.textRight: Yes, there is no longer any doubt about that.
And we've collected the ornaments in order, starting@from the bottom. We are now about halfway up the@tree.

group_1.textLeft: So we only have half of the memories to go...?

group_1.textRight: Well, every tree has a star ornament@placed on top.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, that's correct.
So does that mean there is a star lying@around somewhere in that space?

group_1.textRight: If we start at the bottom and work our way up,@it stands that we should find it at the very end.
My teacher came to the same conclusion.

group_1.textLeft: Then we must collect all of the remaining@red ornaments,
and listen to the voice contained within@the star at the end...
I get the feeling it will be the most crucial@one of them all,
as well as the most terrible...
Mikage...

group_1.textRight: It's okay! It's all just to make things@easier to understand!
If we get to the star at the end,
we'll be able to understand everything@my mom was thinking, yeah?
So don't worry about Mii! I'm not scared!@Let's go, guys!
Fumuuu!
